name: KillProcess
friendlyName: Use PowerShell to kill a process
description: Kill a process with name and path
author: Comerco

inputs.name: ProcessName
inputs.label: Process Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of a process.
Eg: notepad.

inputs.name: ProcessPath
inputs.label: Process Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Absolute path of the source file on the local machine.
Eg: C:\Windows\System32\notepad.exe

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Login
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator login for the target machine.
Eg: domain\username

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for administrator login for the target machine.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: MachineName
inputs.label: Machine name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the machine where the process is running.
